definition: abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: So I won't take with you any more, just let it be.
sentences.chinese: 众口难调，所以我不想再跟你说什么了，随缘吧。

sentences.english: I love my job. Whoo! Makes me feel like Superman!
sentences.chinese: 众口难调，这个和做饭一样，很难让所有人都喜欢的。

sentences.english: To be sure, democratic debate has always been a messy affair in which passion threatens to overwhelm reason.
sentences.chinese: 自然，民主辩论总是众口难调，往往热情取代了理智。

definition: everyone has their likes and dislikes (idiom)
The benevolent sees benevolence, the wise sees wisdom./Different views are admissible. (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 zhe3 jian4 ren2 , zhi4 zhe3 jian4 zhi4

definition: one man's meat is another man's poison (idiom)
pinyin: jia3 zhi1 mi4 tang2 , yi3 zhi1 pi1 shuang1
gong1 shuo1 gong1 you3 li3 , po2 shuo1 po2 you3 li3
related.word: 公说公有理，婆说婆有理

definition: nobody is perfect/everyone has their defect
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
each sticks to his own opinion (idiom); chacun son gout
